required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: SeRenade Parent-Child Music Class Program for Families of Children With and Without ASD

brief_summary.textblock: This pilot study examines the impact of the SeRenade Parent-Child Music Class Program, which emphasizes parent training, peer inclusion, and musical play combined with established behavioral techniques, on the development of child social engagement, positive behavior, and parental well-being.

detailed_description.textblock: This pilot study evaluates the impact of the SeRenade Parent-Child Music Class Program on families of children with and without autism spectrum disorders (ASD). This study examines the impact of this program on social development in children with ASD, parental stress and efficacy, and parent-child relationships. A primary goal of this study is to examine multiple levels of analysis including families' experience within and outside of the music class program.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre to post program (baseline and 12-weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Standardized elicited imitation assessment; scores range 0-32; greater scores indicate greater imitation skills

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre to post program (baseline and 12-weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Standardized parent report questionnaire of child's gestures/actions/pretend play

primary_outcome.measure: Parenting Stress Index, 4th edition Short Form
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre to post program (baseline and 12-weeks)
Change from pre to post program (baseline and 12-weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Parent report questionnaire; higher scores indicate greater efficacy, range 10-40

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre to post program (baseline and 12-weeks)
Change from pre to post program (baseline and 12-weeks)

other_outcome.time_frame: change from before/after the class session at class 1 (week 1) to 12 (week 12) (a session of classes is 12-weeks on average)

arm_group.description: Parent-Child Music Class Program (parent training, peer inclusion, musical play)
Participants do not participate in the program for a time period

intervention.description: Parent-Child Music Class involving parent training, peer inclusion, and musical play

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- children diagnosed with ASD or children without ASD
Exclusion Criteria:
- currently enrolled in music therapy or parent-child music classes (for children with ASD); significant behavior problems (e.g., aggression toward other children); significant hearing or visual impairments

patient_data.ipd_description: Deidentified data and codebooks will be available to researchers upon request.
